questions.question_text:
A company sells large batches of chemicals. Item specifications vary from batch to batch.
You must fulfill multiple orders from the same batch of chemicals. If a single batch cannot be reserved, manual reservation must be used. The system must also make reservations based on the earliest batch receipt date.
You need to set up a new chemical item that automatically uses the new batch reservation logic.
Which three settings should you configure? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

A company uses Process manufacturing for most products and Discreet manufacturing for other products. The company is creating a formula for a new product.
The new item will be used to make a name brand product and two generic brand products.
This item has the following requirements:
✑ Production of the name brand and generic products must use the same formula.
✑ The company must produce all three items at the same time.
You need to create a produced item that can make two generic items and one main item.
How should you set up the item?

discussion.content:
B is correct.

A is incorrect, as planning items are not used for the components of a formula. For this scenario, specify the generics as co-products instead.
C and D are also incorrect, as process manufacturing use formulas, not bill of material type items.

choices.A: Create the name brand product as the main product and use a formula production type. Create the two generic items as a formula planning production type planning items. Copy the formula from the name brand item into each of the generic items.
choices.B: Create the name brand product as the main product and use a formula production type. Create the two generic products as co-products as part of the formula for the name brand product.
choices.C: Create the name brand item as a Bills of material production type item. Create the two generic items as a sub-assembly on the Bills of material for the name brand product.
choices.D: Create the name brand item as a Bills of material production type item. Add the two generic items on the Bills of material for the name brand product and use line type phantom.

questions.question_text:
You are the lead product design manager at a Process manufacturing plant.
You are building a formula that produces egg yolks as a by-product. This by-product is added back into inventory at standard cost and can be used in other production batches.
You need to select the by-product cost allocation.
Which cost allocation type should you use?

discussion.content:
The By-product cost allocation field on the Co-products page is an enumerator field that is used only for by-products. For co-products, the value of this field is always None. For by-product lines, this field determines how the cost amount for the by-product line is added to the total cost of the production.
So it is by product not co-product. For co product cost burden is only none
